t: Awake,*pn awake, put*ld on your strength, O Zion; put*ln on your beautiful garments, O*ld Jerusalem, the holy city; for*ln there shall no more come into you the*ld uncircumcised and the unclean.
Shake*ln yourself from the dust and arise; be*ld seated, O Jerusalem; loose*ln the bonds from your neck, O*ld captive daughter of Zion.
For*p thus says the Lord:*s “You were sold for nothing, and you shall be redeemed without money.”
For thus says the Lord God:*s “My people went down at the first into Egypt to sojourn there, and the Assyrian oppressed them for nothing.
Now therefore what have I here,” declares the Lord,*s “seeing that my people are taken away for nothing? Their rulers wail,” declares the Lord,*s “and continually all the day my name is despised.
Therefore my people shall know my name. Therefore in that day they shall know that it is I who speak; here I am.”

How*pn beautiful upon the mountains are*ld the feet of him who brings good news, who*ln publishes peace, who brings good news of happiness, who*ld publishes salvation, who*ld says to Zion, “Your God reigns.”
The*ln voice of your watchmen— they lift up their voice; together*ld they sing for joy; for*ln eye to eye they see the*ld return of the Lord*s to Zion.
Break*ln forth together into singing, you*ld waste places of Jerusalem, for*ln the Lord*s has comforted his people; he*ld has redeemed Jerusalem.
The*ln Lord*s has bared his holy arm before*ld the eyes of all the nations, and*ln all the ends of the earth shall see the*ld salvation of our God.
Depart,*pn depart, go out from there; touch*ld no unclean thing; go*ln out from the midst of her; purify yourselves, you*ld who bear the vessels of the Lord.*s
For*ln you shall not go out in haste, and*ld you shall not go in flight, for*ln the Lord*s will go before you, and*ld the God of Israel will be your rear guard.
He Was Pierced for Our Transgressions
Behold,*pn my servant shall act wisely; he*ld shall be high and lifted up, and*ld shall be exalted.
As*ln many were astonished at you— his*ld appearance was so marred, beyond human semblance, and*ld his form beyond that of the children of mankind—
so*ln shall he sprinkle many nations. Kings*ld shall shut their mouths because of him, for*ln that which has not been told them they see, and*ld that which they have not heard they understand.
